node.title: Sean Parnell Suspends G.O.P. Senate Bid in Pennsylvania
node.alt: Sean Parnell suspended his campaign for the Senate seat held by Pat Toomey, a Republican who is retiring.
node.description: Mr. Parnell, who was endorsed by Donald Trump in one of the highest-profile 2022 Senate races, had been accused by his estranged wife of spousal and child abuse.
node.content: ["Sean Parnell, a leading Republican candidate for Senate from Pennsylvania, suspended his campaign on Monday after a judge ruled that his estranged wife should get primary custody of their three children in a case in which she accused him of spousal and child abuse.", "Mr. Parnell, who was endorsed by former President Donald J. Trump in September, said he was \u201cdevastated\u201d by the decision and planned to appeal.", "\u201cThere is nothing more important to me than my children, and while I plan to ask the court to reconsider, I can\u2019t continue with a Senate campaign,\u201d he said in a statement. \u201cMy focus right now is 100% on my children, and I want them to know I do not have any other priorities and will never stop fighting for them.\u201d", "Mr. Parnell\u2019s estranged wife, Laurie Snell, testified in court this month that Mr. Parnell had repeatedly abused her and their children, choking her and hitting one of their children so hard that he left a welt on the child\u2019s back. The Butler County judge wrote that he found Ms. Snell to be \u201cthe more credible witness\u201d and that he believed Mr. Parnell had committed \u201csome acts of abuse in the past,\u201d according to The Philadelphia Inquirer.", "The Pennsylvania seat, currently held by Senator Pat Toomey, a Republican, is widely considered one of the most competitive Senate races in 2022."]
